    • Method Detail

      • getFileExtensions

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getFileExtensions()

      • getMagicNumberHexStrings

        protected abstract java.lang.String[] getMagicNumberHexStrings()
        Returns an array of hex strings representing the respective magic numbers of this media type. E.g. the mp3 file format has 'ID3' as magic number, which is '49 44 33' as a hex string. The hex string may contain empty spaces for improved readability. Furthermore it may contain wildcards in the form of 'nn' which denotes any hex item, e.g. '12 34 nn 56' matches '12 34 11 56' as well as '12 34 22 56'.

      • isOfThisType

        public boolean isOfThisType(java.io.File file)

      • fileStartsWith

        public boolean fileStartsWith(java.io.File file,
                     java.lang.String magicByteHexString)
